page.title: 08Education Dalgety Bay.
page.content: Children between the ages of 5 and 12 attend either of two primary schools. The first school built, Dalgety Bay Primary, was traditionally designed with individual classrooms. All the classrooms form a square round a central courtyard. A main feature of these classrooms is the large glass windows. This school also incorporates a nursery which offers pre-school activities. The more recent school, Donibristle Primary completed in 1979, is an open plan school where individual classrooms do not exist. Instead there are open areas with class teachers and pupils from different classes sharing space and materials. Parents now have a choice as to which school they send their children. Normally they send their children to the school which is closer to their home.
